questions.question: Which of the following tasks is best suited for AI/ML applications?
questions.option_a: A. Calculating grades in a school examination
questions.option_b: B. Predicting next week’s vegetable prices
questions.option_c: C. Calculating the salary of an employee
questions.explanation: AI/ML excels at prediction problems such as forecasting prices based on historical data.

questions.question: What distinguishes Generative AI from Predictive AI?
questions.option_a: A. Generative AI creates brand new content
questions.option_b: B. Predictive AI only generates images
questions.option_c: C. Generative AI always requires labeled data
questions.option_d: D. Predictive AI cannot be used for classification tasks
questions.explanation: Generative AI focuses on producing new content, while predictive AI focuses on predicting outcomes from input data.

questions.question: Which architecture introduced by Google in 2017 powers modern LLMs?
questions.explanation: The Transformer architecture, introduced in 'Attention is All You Need' (2017), is the backbone of modern LLMs.

questions.question: ChatGPT is an example of which type of model?
questions.explanation: ChatGPT is an autoregressive language model that generates text sequentially based on prior tokens.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common use case of Generative AI?
questions.explanation: Predicting exam grades is more suited to predictive models, not generative AI.

questions.question: Reasoning models such as OpenAI o1 and Grok 3 are designed primarily for?
questions.option_b: B. Reinforcement learning with complex reasoning
questions.explanation: Reasoning models are trained with reinforcement learning to solve complex reasoning and planning tasks.

questions.question: Which of the following is a closed AI model?
questions.explanation: GPT-4 is a closed-source model with proprietary access, unlike LLaMA, Mistral, and Falcon.

questions.question: What is the primary advantage of open AI models like LLaMA?
questions.option_d: D. Higher inference speed than all models
questions.explanation: Open models are community-driven, customizable, and transparent due to public availability of code and weights.

questions.question: Which platform provides access to pre-trained models, datasets, and tools like the Transformers library?
questions.explanation: Hugging Face provides a hub of pre-trained models, datasets, and libraries like Transformers.

questions.question: What are parameters in a machine learning model?
questions.option_b: B. Learned components that capture patterns
questions.option_d: D. Tokens fed into the model
questions.explanation: Parameters are the learned internal values that allow the model to represent knowledge and patterns.

questions.question: GPT-3 has approximately how many parameters?
questions.explanation: GPT-3 is widely known to have 175 billion parameters, making it a large-scale language model.

questions.question: What does the context window of a language model represent?
questions.option_a: A. The number of parameters in the model
questions.option_b: B. The maximum input size the model can process
questions.option_c: C. The accuracy of the model
questions.option_d: D. The time taken for training
questions.explanation: The context window is the maximum amount of text (tokens) a model can consider at once.

questions.question: Which LLM has the largest context window as per the lecture?
questions.explanation: LLaMA 4 sets a benchmark with a context window of about 10 million tokens.

questions.question: Training a model requires which of the following resources?
questions.option_a: A. Small datasets and CPU processing
questions.option_b: B. Massive datasets and GPU/TPU hardware
questions.option_d: D. Low memory and short computation time
questions.explanation: Training requires large datasets and powerful hardware like GPUs/TPUs, often over long durations.

questions.question: Inference in machine learning refers to:
questions.option_a: A. Training the model with new data
questions.option_b: B. Compressing the model for faster use
questions.option_c: C. Using a trained model to make predictions
questions.option_d: D. Evaluating model accuracy after training
questions.explanation: Inference is the process of applying a trained model to generate predictions from new input data.

questions.question: Fine-tuning a model refers to:
questions.option_a: A. Training a model from scratch on large datasets
questions.option_b: B. Customizing a pre-trained model on domain-specific tasks
questions.option_c: C. Compressing a model for deployment
questions.explanation: Fine-tuning adjusts a pre-trained model for domain-specific performance and customization.

questions.question: Model distillation involves:
questions.option_a: A. Expanding a model with more parameters
questions.option_b: B. Compressing a large model into a smaller one
questions.option_c: C. Adding noise to training data
questions.option_d: D. Reducing token size during inference
questions.explanation: Distillation transfers knowledge from a large teacher model to a smaller student model for efficiency.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a Small Language Model (SLM)?
questions.explanation: TinyLLaMA is a lightweight SLM designed for efficiency in low-resource environments.

questions.question: Why are SLMs useful?
questions.option_a: A. They provide better reasoning than larger models
questions.option_b: B. They are optimized for fast inference and resource efficiency
questions.option_c: C. They always outperform larger LLMs
questions.option_d: D. They have infinite context windows
questions.explanation: SLMs are efficient, faster, and suitable for low-resource environments, unlike larger LLMs.

questions.question: Which Hugging Face feature allows instant cloud-based model execution?
questions.explanation: The Hugging Face Inference API allows immediate execution of models in the cloud without local setup.

questions.question: What is the main role of the Transformers library in Hugging Face?
questions.option_b: B. Running top AI models across tasks
questions.explanation: The Transformers library enables access and use of state-of-the-art AI models across tasks like text, images, and audio.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a foundation model?
questions.explanation: Foundation models like GPT, BERT, and PaLM are large pre-trained models built for general-purpose AI tasks.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a context window?
questions.option_a: A. Defines the training time of a model
questions.option_b: B. Determines the size of the dataset
questions.option_c: C. Defines how much prior input the model can consider
questions.explanation: The context window controls how much prior text the model can use when generating output.

questions.question: Which of these models is known as multimodal?
questions.explanation: Models like GPT-4o and Gemini are multimodal, handling multiple data types such as text, images, and audio.

questions.question: Which best describes the difference between training and inference?
questions.option_a: A. Training uses small datasets while inference uses big datasets
questions.option_b: B. Training is expensive and slow, inference is fast and lightweight
questions.option_c: C. Training occurs on mobile, inference on GPUs
questions.option_d: D. Training is optional, inference is mandatory
questions.explanation: Training requires large resources and is slow, while inference is optimized for fast predictions.

questions.question: Which Hugging Face tool allows hosting ML apps using frameworks like Gradio?
questions.explanation: Hugging Face Spaces enables users to host ML apps using frameworks like Gradio and Streamlit.

questions.question: Which of the following best explains why parameters are important?
questions.option_b: B. They determine a model’s ability to learn and store patterns
questions.option_c: C. They only control inference speed
questions.option_d: D. They are fixed by developers manually
questions.explanation: Parameters allow a model to store knowledge and recognize complex patterns from training data.

questions.question: Which programming library call in Hugging Face is used for text summarization?
questions.explanation: The 'summarization' pipeline in Hugging Face is designed for text summarization tasks.

questions.question: Why should students avoid using ChatGPT only to get answers?
questions.option_b: B. It reduces brain activity and learning
questions.option_c: C. It is slower than searching the web
questions.option_d: D. It is banned in all universities
questions.explanation: Using AI solely for answers reduces active brain engagement and hinders genuine understanding.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT listed as a use of Generative AI in education?
questions.explanation: Payroll calculation is not an educational use case for Generative AI.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of prompt engineering?
questions.option_a: A. Compressing models into smaller versions
questions.option_b: B. Designing better input instructions for LLMs
questions.explanation: Prompt engineering refers to designing precise prompts that guide model output effectively.

questions.question: What is the output of inference when asking 'What is the capital of France?'
questions.explanation: The model predicts 'Paris' as the capital of France.

questions.question: Why is fine-tuning often applied to pre-trained models?
questions.option_a: A. To reduce the model size
questions.option_b: B. To adapt models to specific domains
questions.option_d: D. To increase the number of parameters
questions.explanation: Fine-tuning adapts general-purpose models to perform better on domain-specific data.

questions.question: Which type of AI focuses on predicting outcomes rather than generating new content?
questions.explanation: Discriminative or Predictive AI is focused on predicting outcomes based on input data.

questions.question: Which is an advantage of Hugging Face’s pre-built models?
questions.option_a: A. No need to train models from scratch
questions.explanation: Pre-built models save time by avoiding training from scratch and allow quick deployment.

questions.question: Which company developed the Transformer architecture?
questions.explanation: The Transformer architecture was introduced by Google researchers in 2017.

questions.question: What is the primary reason training models is costly?
questions.option_b: B. Needs massive datasets and high computation
questions.explanation: Training is costly because it requires vast datasets and high-performance hardware for weeks or months.

questions.question: Which model is an example of a distilled version of a large transformer?
questions.explanation: DistilBERT is a smaller, faster version of BERT created through model distillation.

questions.question: Why do reasoning models like DeepSeek DeepThink R1 excel at complex problem solving?
questions.option_b: B. They produce a chain of thought before answering
questions.option_d: D. They are trained only on images
questions.explanation: Reasoning models generate internal chains of thought before answering, improving problem-solving accuracy.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of an API call in GenAI applications?
questions.explanation: openai.ChatCompletion.create() is used to call LLMs in GenAI-based applications.

questions.question: Which Hugging Face feature provides thousands of ready-to-use models?
questions.explanation: Model Hub is Hugging Face’s repository of thousands of pre-trained models.

questions.question: Which model family is designed for handling multiple modalities such as text, image, and video?
questions.explanation: Multimodal models can process multiple types of input like text, image, audio, and video.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about inference is TRUE?
questions.option_a: A. Inference is slower than training
questions.option_b: B. Inference predicts outputs using a trained model
questions.option_c: C. Inference increases the number of parameters
questions.option_d: D. Inference modifies the model weights
questions.explanation: Inference applies a trained model to new inputs for predictions, much faster than training.

questions.question: Which tool from Hugging Face is used for sharing and running ML demos?
questions.explanation: Spaces allows deployment and sharing of ML demos using frameworks like Gradio and Streamlit.

questions.question: Which LLM was highlighted in the lecture for achieving 1 million token context windows?
questions.explanation: Gemini 1.5 was noted for achieving context windows up to 1 million tokens.

questions.question: Which of these statements about foundation models is FALSE?
questions.option_a: A. They are pre-trained on broad datasets
questions.option_b: B. They can be fine-tuned for specific tasks
questions.option_c: C. They are designed for narrow, single-purpose use only
questions.option_d: D. Examples include GPT and PaLM
questions.explanation: Foundation models are general-purpose and broad, not narrow single-task models.

questions.question: Which company provides Claude 2/3 as a closed model?
questions.explanation: Claude models are developed by Anthropic and are closed-source.

questions.question: What is the main educational benefit of using GenAI tools in learning?
questions.option_b: B. Supporting brainstorming and content generation
questions.explanation: GenAI helps in brainstorming, summarizing, and creating FAQs to support learning.

questions.question: What does 'Attention is All You Need' introduce?
questions.explanation: The 2017 paper 'Attention is All You Need' introduced the Transformer model.
